Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff home run in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Long lines of cars were backed up on roads around the stadium five hours before the game.
Only the first 40,000 fans received the bobblehead, which depicted a smiling Ohtani holding Decoy.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts said he is still surprised by the mania that surrounds Ohtani.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first Ohtani bobblehead giveaway in May attracted a sellout crowd of 53,527 — the largest in the majors this season and the most at Dodger Stadium since Sept. 20, 2019.
Ohtani became the fastest player in major league history — and sixth ever — with 40 home runs and 40 stolen bases in the same season.
Others: The promotion snarled traffic for hours ahead of game time.
Ohtani joined the Dodgers last December, signing a $700 million, 10-year contract.
